pageContext.description: Looped, Sides untrimmed. Central ridge down faces.
pageContext.other: 4 cross section drawings of palstave on reverse.,Loop is intact but appears heavily encrusted.,Butt damaged, with large angular portion missing.,Side ridges? appears to be a large section missing on one face of blade, either side ridge or lack of encrustment.
pageContext.associations: 1 leaf-shaped sword with transitional hilt, 1 fragment of sword blade.
pageContext.site: England, essex[southend-on-sea,southchurch,thorpe hall brickfield (about 1000 yds. e. of thorpe bay rly station. <.m.s.),3 ft. 6 in. deep in brick-earth containing fragments of bone & charcoal,23rd february. 1929.
pageContext.remarks: The brickfield is worked to a depth of 7 ft: beneath the brick earth is ballast & sand. Excavating around the silt produced no additional objects.
